description:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres; you will keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.

As a Program Manager within the Product Readiness Group, you will be responsible for projects as you take them through the Hardware Planning and Fulfillment development lifecycle and ensure they meet all success criteria and objectives at each phase. You will lead cross-functional project teams and partner with various stakeholders to develop and execute project plans, drive risk assessment and mitigation, and provide clear/concise communication at all levels of the organization. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated and leadership informed on the project's progress and deadlines. You will also drive key cross-functional initiatives in support of scalable, sustainable growth of the organization and its partners.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Hardware team researches, designs, and develops new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, more powerful, and seamless. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, our Hardware team is making people's lives better through technology.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • 5 years of experience as a Program Manager in Supply Chain/Operations.
  • Experience in project or program management.
  • Experience with lifecycle management methodologies, processes, and tools.
  • Experience in process/workflow design and optimization.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Direct experience working with global cross-functional teams in the technology/distribution market.
  • Detail oriented; excellent communication, organizational, analytical and problem solving skills.
responsibilities:
• Drive Hardware product launch readiness through the Hardware Planning and Fulfillment (HWPF) Product Development Process, developing and executing applicable program plans, driving risk assessment and mitigation, and representing HWPF as a single point of contact in a fast-paced environment with evolving priorities.
  • Oversee and drive key HWPF activities for Hardware product expansion into new countries
  • Identify and solve cross-functional and inter-team issues quickly and effectively.
  • Partner with internal and external functions to support planning and on-time delivery of non-commercial units for purposes of in-store retail marketing, partner demos, etc.
  • Identify and drive opportunities to enhance and streamline tools and processes to enable scalable solutions in support of on-time product launches.
title: Program Manager, Hardware Product Readiness Group
